scenes.raw_text: Let us finish it. (BIRDS CHIRPING) DEL TORO: (WHISPERING) Perhaps it is a trap. It is. DEL TORO: Then what do we do? We break through. - There. - I see him. Pagans! (SHOUTING INDISTINCTLY) Forward still. - DEL TORO: Retreat! - No! Do not stop! DEL TORO: Let's go! No! (GRUNTING) (SCREAMING) We are her salvation... and through her command, we shall live forever! I will not die. Not here. Not now. Never! (GRUNTING) (SHOUTING INDISTINCTLY) (SPEAKING IN MAYAN) (GRUNTING) No! (WHISPERING) We're almost there. You'll make it. I won't let you die. Strong enough. IZZI: (WHISPERS) Finish it. (GASPS) Don't worry, we'll be all right. I just need to take a little. IZZI: (WHISPERS) Finish it. - Hey, what are you doing here? - Take a walk with me. I have too much work. - It's the first snow. We... - I know, but they're waiting. - Come on, Tommy. - Please, Izzi! I'm sorry. I am. I'll see you tonight. IZZI: (WHISPERS) Finish it. Please, leave me alone. I don't know how it ends. All right. I trust you. Take me. Show me. - What are you doing here? - Take a walk with me. I have too much work. - It's the first snow. We... - But they're waiting. - Come on, Tommy. - Please, Izzi. I'm sorry. I am. I'll see you tonight, okay? Izzi. Hey! Dr. Creo. Antonio's on his way back. Donovan's open and ready. His vitals are steady. - Damn it. - Come on. TOMMY: Did he say if it was working? MANNY: He just told me to grab you and meet in surgery. TOMMY: Where is he? MANNY: I'm not sure. TOMMY: Call him. MANNY: Okay. HENRY: Antonio sent me ahead with the scans. He's still busy in chem lab. MANNY: Hey, it's Manny. MANNY: Where's Antonio? HENRY: It's still growing aggressively. TOMMY: That much in two days? MANNY: What do you mean, you don't know? Go get him. Find him. BETTY: He's been lying open 50 minutes now. MANNY: He's crossing the street. TOMMY: What were the in vitro results? MANNY: I didn't ask. TOMMY: Meet at the elevator. Get his ass in here. Micro-manipulator's at 42 degrees... - mediolateral's 72. - Yep. How we doing, Donovan? You hanging in? ANTONIO: No good. Great specificity, but no suppression. BETTY: Should we close him? HENRY: We'll have to euthanize. BETTY: Why? HENRY: We don't treat now... we won't have another chance before the growth gets him. TOMMY: Damn it! (SIGHS) BETTY: I'll prepare the pentobarbital.

scenes.raw_text: No, wait. ANTONIO: What is it? Remember that compound we played around with? - Which one? - TOMMY: From that tree. That one from Central America. - That one. - MANNY: Natul tortuosa. 82-A46. - From Guatemala. - ANTONIO: The old-growth tree. We had samples, but it was sterile. The graftings and clippings didn't take. - That's it. - BETTY: All right, what's happening? Mix it with your compound. They got a similar structure. A mirror. Manny, find those samples. MANNY: Yeah. ANTONIO: I don't see it. Picture them side by side. Fold them into each other like two lovers, woman on top. They have complementary domains. If we can get them to stick... Is this it? TOMMY: Go! Doctor, we have no toxicity reports. There's not a single... Doesn't matter. Donovan's on the table. If we do nothing, he dies. - Antonio, how long? - Two hours. TOMMY: Keep him under. I've never seen that adhesion pattern. What's it binding to? Don't know. But it's definitely attaching to the high-growth regions. Let's do it. BETTY: 0.75, 1, 1.25. ANTONIO: Syringe is loaded. TOMMY: Give it. Manny, give me light. Lowering. Injecting. ANTONIO: Injection at 2357. BETTY: 2357. TOMMY: That's a good boy, Donovan. That's a good boy. ANTONIO: What's up, captain? TOMMY: My ring. - MANNY: What ring? - My wedding ring. - MANNY: Where'd you leave it? - Right there, where I always put it. MANNY: Must've gotten knocked on the ground. LILLIAN: Tommy? TOMMY: Yeah? - May I have a word with you? - One second. What are you doing? - It's my ring. I put it there. - MANNY: It's gotta be here. I need to talk to you. Don't worry about it. We'll find it. LILLIAN: Tommy... I'm concerned. What? I saw Betty in the hall. - Oh... - She was hysterical. - You've been running sloppy surgeries. - Nonsense. LILLIAN: You injected that animal with an untested compound. Look, he was open, for chrissakes. We were about to put him down. NIH could shut us down. I should shut you down for it. You're reckless, and you're losing perspective. Look, why don't you just take a few days at home? Spend a little time with Izzi. But I'm here for her. (SIGHS) (BIRDS CHIRPING) Izzi? Izzi? Iz? Izzi? Izzi! Izzi? Izzi! - IZZI: Tommy? - Isabel. (IZZI LAUGHING) Funny. Very funny. What are you doing? I'm... I'm stargazing. I found it in the attic. Come on in, it's freezing.

scenes.raw_text: No, I want you to see something. Come on. You're an old fart. TOMMY: Okay. IZZI: Okay. Go on, look. - TOMMY: Mm. - You see it? TOMMY: The gold star? It's actually a nebula wrapped around a dying star. That's what makes it look gold. What? - I took science. - When? Junior high. God. The Mayans called it Shibalba. TOMMY: Shibalba? - It was their underworld. - Hmm. The place the dead souls go to be reborn. What? What are you talking about? My book. I'm writing about it. - I thought it took place in Spain. - Begins there. Ends there. TOMMY: Are you done? - Almost. - Good. When do I read it? Someday soon it will explode, die and give birth to new stars. And how amazing that the Mayans chose a dying star to represent their underworld. Of all the healthy points of light in the sky... how did they find one that was dying? Where are your shoes? Izzi. Come on, come on. Let's warm you up. Whoa, whoa. Careful. Okay. I'll get it. I'll get it. Careful. Iz? (IZZI LAUGHING) TOMMY: Stop it. No. Get inside. Stop it. Ow! IZZI: Serves you right. Is she a redhead? What? I left it in surgery. If you can't wait, you can't wait. I'm joking. - I'll make some coffee. - Wait. The sponge. I want you to heat it. Outside, before, you couldn't feel the cold. Tommy. - I'm calling Dr. Lipper. - No. I'm afraid. Jeez, I'm sorry. Shh. - IZZI: It's been happening for a while. - What? I've been losing sensitivity to hot and cold. - Why didn't you tell me? - Because I feel different. Inside. I feel different. Every moment. Each one. Tommy? Oh, Jesus. Don't worry, don't worry. All right? I'm here. I will always be here. Listen, I'm not really sure this is... Oh... IZZI: (WHISPERS) Gotcha. (PHONE RINGING) - ALAN: Hello? - Alan. Tommy. ALAN: Tommy. How's Izzi? - What's the earliest you can see us? - Let me check my schedule. It's time for you to read it. TOMMY: (WHISPERS) Hey. - How's 3? - That's your earliest? - I'm in surgery till then. Is it urgent? - No, that's fine. Thanks, Alan. Bye. - We're gonna see him tomorrow. - Start it. Tell me what you think. - But it's not done. - Not quite. (PHONE RINGING) (WHISPERS) Don't answer it. - Hello? - ANTONIO: Captain. - What's wrong? - Get down here. - What is it? - Donovan. I've never seen anything like it. - Is he okay? - He's fine. Perfectly fine. - What's happening? - You won't believe me.

scenes.raw_text: You gotta see it for yourself. Come. Come right away. Uh... No, I can't now. I can't. MANNY, BETTY, HENRY & ANTONIO: To Donovan. - What's going on? - ANTONIO: Show him. I came around 1 to check up on Donovan. TOMMY: Where is Donovan? HENRY: That's him. (DONOVAN GIBBERING) What? It can't be. His scalp's almost healed. There's hair growth. ANTONIO: I didn't believe either. And it gets stranger. Antonio had me run some tests. Donovan responded well. Really well. Pulled up videos of him pre-op. He's testing twice as well as last week. HENRY: We see an increase in neural activity... throughout all the areas usually stunted by normal aging. (CHUCKLING) - And the tumor? - No change. The growth patterns are normal. There's no positive or negative effect. - BETTY: We should tell Dr. Guzetti right away. - No. No. Antonio... prep a new cocktail. Stick with the same substance... - but add... - ANTONIO: What? - We're moving forward. - BETTY: Wait a minute. This could be a medical first. A revelation. We gotta pursue it. Duplicate the findings. You can monitor the monkey's growth, but our focus remains tumors, not aging. - I know, but we... - TOMMY: Stop. I want the next subject prepped and ready for surgery. (WHISPERING) Is everything all right? Yes. Everything's all right. (CRYING) (GRUNTING) (KNOCKING ON DOOR) MONK: Inquisitor? Enter. MONK: The heretics. They have confessed and ceded their lands to your Holy Office. They await your judgment. Yet another slice of her nation is mine. Soon she will be powerless against me. Queen of nothing but her sins. MONK: What will you do with her? SILECIO: She too will confess, and then... she too will die. ARIEL: Captain. 'Tis the queen. She is surrounded. The inquisitor demands blood. Then there is no more time. What is our response? Go now. Warn the queen. And you, where are you going? - He must be cut out. - She has forbidden it. There is no other choice. This is our only hope. (HORSE GALLOPING) (GRUNTS) TOMAS: Stay. Stay. Our bodies are prisons for our souls. Our skin and blood, the iron bars of confinement. But fear not. All flesh decays. Death turns all to ash. And thus... death frees every soul. (PRISONERS CRYING) You... the condemned. You have confessed. You admit to protecting a queen... who twists the word of God...

Warn the queen. And you, where are you going? - He must be cut out. - She has forbidden it. There is no other choice. This is our only hope.   TOMAS: Stay. Stay. Our bodies are prisons for our souls. scenes.raw_text: and drowns all Spain in sin. Your queen seeks immortality on Earth. A false paradise. This is heresy. She leads you towards vanity... away from the Spirit. But this is foolishness... for death exists. The Day of Judgment is irrefutable. All life must be judged. (CLATTERING IN DISTANCE) (FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING) (GRUNTING) - Why are you here? - Come quickly. - No. Leave. Protect the queen. - She sent me. She demands your return. Not before he dies. No, Tomas. Leave him. She desires a private audience. SILECIO: But fear not. She will not be in hell alone. I will make sure her servants are waiting. (PRISONERS SCREAMING) (THUDS) (HORSE GALLOPING) (CRYING) ISABEL: Faithful servant, why do you cry? To see Spain brought so low... with an enemy thriving within her borders, feasting on her strength. The shame is too much. I failed her. Dare not pity Spain. These times are dark... but every shadow, no matter how deep, is threatened by morning light. Of course. ISABEL: This loyalty of yours... inspires you to protect Spain at any cost. But killing the inquisitor is suicide. Europe would have my head. I, for one, am not ready to die yet. - Are you? - I will die for Spain. I know, conquistador. I know. And this bravery of yours, it may save us yet. For Spain has a plan. There is hope. - There's hope? - Father. I am Father Avila, of Her Royal Franciscan Order. Our allegiance remains with Spain. Father. Guards, leave us. Conquistador... I am going to tell you the true reason why the inquisitor pits cross against crown. One year ago... Father Avila returned from the jungles of New Spain... with a secret so great, it promised to free all mankind from tyranny. Spain desired this treasure above all things. But the inquisitor feared it with equal measure. When I refused to give up my quest for it... he responded with this violent coup to bring Spain to her knees. But we have not yielded. And now we will defeat him. This is our hope. A dagger? Used in religious rituals. I took it from a dead Mayan priest. The marking on the hilt... Do you see it? It is a map. A map to the Mayans' greatest secret. Greater than Chichén Itzá, greater than Yaxchilán. Greater even than Tikal. Here, in the center... in the core of the once-great Mayan civilization... we will find a lost pyramid.

These times are dark... but every shadow, no matter how deep, is threatened by morning light. Of course. ISABEL: This loyalty of yours... inspires you to protect Spain at any cost. But killing the inquisitor is suicide. Europe would have my head. I, for one, am not ready to die yet. - Are you? - I will die for Spain. I know, conquistador. I know. And this bravery of yours, it may save us yet. For Spain has a plan. There is hope. - There's hope? - Father. I am Father Avila, of Her Royal Franciscan Order. Our allegiance remains with Spain. Father. Guards, leave us. Conquistador... I am going to tell you the true reason why the inquisitor pits cross against crown. One year ago... Father Avila returned from the jungles of New Spain... with a secret so great, it promised to free all mankind from tyranny. Spain desired this treasure above all things. But the inquisitor feared it with equal measure. When I refused to give up my quest for it... he responded with this violent coup to bring Spain to her knees. But we have not yielded. And now we will defeat him. This is our hope. A dagger? Used in religious rituals. I took it from a dead Mayan priest. The marking on the hilt... Do you see it? It is a map. A map to the Mayans' greatest secret. Greater than Chichén Itzá, greater than Yaxchilán. Greater even than Tikal. Here, in the center... in the core of the once-great Mayan civilization... we will find a lost pyramid.

scenes.raw_text: No. Not lost. Hidden. A hidden pyramid of the Mayan myths. The myths tell us of a holy pyramid built upon the navel of the earth. The birthplace of life. A special tree sprouts there. They say whoever drinks of its sap... will live forever. Eternal life? As Spain's fate hangs at the whims of a merciless enemy... - you dare taunt us with pagan yarns! - They are not yarns. Remember... our own Bible confirms it. In Genesis, there are two trees in the Garden of Eden. The tree of knowledge and the tree of life. When Adam and Eve disobeyed and ate from the tree of knowledge... the Lord banned them from the garden and hid the tree of life. Could it be? Could it be? Kneel, conquistador. Let in the morning light. The beast runs amok in my kingdom. He has isolated me. And now he is sharpening his talons for one more fateful push. But salvation lies in the jungles of New Spain. Will you deliver Spain from bondage? Upon my honor and my life. Then you shall take this ring to remind you of your promise. You shall wear it when you find Eden. And when you return... I shall be your Eve. Together, we will live forever. (GASPS) Iz? Izzi? TOMMY: There you are. - Hey, what are you doing here? - Babe, we have Lipper at 3. This is an actual Mayan book. Look. It explains the Creation myth. You see, that's First Father. He's the very first human. Oof. Is he dead? He sacrificed himself to make the world. That's the tree of life, out of his stomach. - Hey, come. - Listen. His body became the tree's roots. They spread and formed the Earth. His soul became the branches, rising up, forming the sky. All that remained was First Father's head. His children hung it in the heavens, creating Shibalba. Shibalba? The star. Uh... Nebula. So, what do you think? - About? - That idea. Death as an act of creation. (CHILDREN CHATTERING INDISTINCTLY) WOMAN: Stay together, guys. I'll pull out the car and meet you in front. (GASPING) TOMMY: Iz. Iz! - TOMMY: Hi. - Tommy. TOMMY: Hey. Tommy. You're all right. I'm close. No. There are options. We will have to make some choices. Alan? You had a minor seizure. The growth in your brain stem's back and it's growing faster. - The next time... - No. No. We had a breakthrough. I know I can translate it to help you. I just need a little more time. Okay?

Death as an act of creation.  WOMAN: Stay together, guys. I'll pull out the car and meet you in front.  TOMMY: Iz. Iz! - TOMMY: Hi. - Tommy. TOMMY: Hey. Tommy. You're all right. I'm close. The growth in your brain stem's back and it's growing faster. - The next time... - No. No. We had a breakthrough. I know I can translate it to help you. I just need a little more time. Okay?

scenes.raw_text: There's hope. There's real hope. - Tommy. - What? What, baby? I wasn't afraid. TOMMY: I know. You're very strong. No. No. What? When I fell... I was full. Held. I know. I caught you. scenes.raw_text: - I want you to help me. - How? Finish it. - Finish it. - The...? - I don't know how it ends. - You do. You will. Stop it. - Remember Moses Morales? - Who? The Mayan guide I told you about. - From your trip? - Yeah. The last night I was with him, he told me about his father, who had died. But Moses wouldn't believe it. - Izzi. - No. No. Listen. Listen. He said... if they dug his father's body up, he would be gone. They planted a seed over his grave. The seed became a tree. Moses said his father became part of that tree. He grew into the wood... into the bloom. And when a sparrow ate the tree's fruit... his father flew with the birds. He said... death was his father's road to awe. That's what he called it. "The road to awe." Now, I've been trying to write the last chapter... and I haven't been able to get that out of my head. Why are you telling me this? I'm not afraid anymore, Tommy. (WHISPERS) I asked Lilly... if I could be buried at her farm. TOMMY: Oh, stop it! I want you to be with me. I am with you. Look. I'll always be with you. I promise. Will you stay with me tonight? Yeah, I'll stay. (IZZI SIGHS) I'll stay. (WHISPERING) Don't worry. We're almost there. Through that last dark cloud is a dying star. And soon enough, Shibalba will die. And when it explodes, you will be reborn. You will bloom. And I will live. (WHISPERS) Don't worry. We're almost there. (THUNDER CRASHES) (THUNDER CRASHING) AVILA: Thank you, Lord. We are here! (GRUNTS) Circles. He leads us in circles. Only we are left. All of your countrymen are dead. He killed them all, with this blind quest. It's time. Time to stop him. Captain. We are lost. The Franciscan and his tales are false. There is no hope for us here. There's only death. - I've mapped a course back to the ships. - Coward. Damn the maps. (GRUNTING) ARIEL: No! We are close, and I will find it. AVILA: Captain! Captain! Captain. TOMAS: Father. What is it, Franciscan? In the jungle. TOMAS: Yes, Father. AVILA: The markings on the hilt. TOMAS: On the dagger? AVILA: It is the same. - TOMAS: The same? - The same as on the stone. (GASPING) (GRUNTING) Your choice. Die now, or by my side, fight to live. You fool. AVILA: Captain. - Father. Take it. We are here. - Where? - The temple is there. (GRUNTS) (WHISPERS) Sorry, Father. For you, there is only death.

scenes.raw_text: But our destiny is life. (INHALING DEEPLY) ISABEL: You shall wear it when you find Eden. And when you return... I shall be your Eve. (EKG BEEPING RAPIDLY) Iz? Iz! Jesus Christ. Oh, come on, come on, come on. Oh, don't. Please. Please. NURSE 1: Step aside. DOCTOR: She's in defib. Pulse thready. NURSE 1: I'm bagging. NURSE 2: Sir. DOCTOR: What's the rhythm? - SPENCER: Get the family out. Get him out! - Sir, please! SPENCER: Give me the pads. DOCTOR: Charging. Pulse thready. What's the pressure? Oh, God. (PANTING) LILLIAN: Tommy? I know. I know. I've never seen anything like it. - Antonio didn't reach you? - What? It's Donovan. The growth is shrinking. It's like the disease is cured. Izzi. Izzi! (WHISPERS) Izzi. - No, no, no, no! - Sir. Please, sir. Sir. Sir, it's too late. I'm gonna have to ask you to leave. Sir. It's too late! (GRUNTING) NURSE 1: Stop him. Let him go. NURSE 2: Get off! (GASPS) (TREE CREAKING) No. No. No! No, no, no! Don't die. Don't die. Don't die. Don't die. No! No! No! Don't die. LILLIAN: It seems to me that we... struggle all our lives to become whole. Complete enough when we die... to achieve a measure of grace. Few of us ever do. Most of us end up going out the way we came in, kicking and screaming. But somehow, Izzi, young as she was... she achieved that grace. In her last days, she became whole. She saw her... Tommy? - Tommy. - Just stop it! (WHISPERING) Death is a disease. It's like any other. And there's a cure. A cure. And I will find it. No! (GRUNTS) (SOBBING) TOM: (WHISPERING) All these years... all these memories... there's been you. You pulled me through time. HENRY: Dr. Creo. MANNY: Dr. Creo, we heard you were back. TOMMY: Update me on everything we know about that tree. Every detail. I'm okay. Everything's fine. The Donovan breakthrough's our starting point. It's just a starting point. All right? Let's build on it. Stop aging. Stop dying. Stop dying. That's our goal. Scans, cultures, charts. Let's get to work. Come on, let's get to work. (WHISPERING) Shibalba. We're here. We almost made it. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. IZZI: (WHISPERS) Finish it. Stop it. Stop it! What do you want? Leave me alone! Please, please. I'm afraid. (SOBBING) Will you deliver Spain from bondage? I don't know. I'm trying. I don't know how. You do. You will. You do. You will. (INAUDIBLE DIALOGUE) IZZI: (WHISPERING) I'm not afraid anymore, Tommy.

Okay. - TOMMY: What are you doing here? - Take a walk with me. I have too much work. - It's the first snow. We always... - They're waiting on me. - Come on, Tommy. - Please, Izzi. I'm sorry. I am. I'll see you tonight, okay? (SIGHS) Izzi. Hey! Dr. Creo. Antonio's on his way back. Donovan's open and ready. His vitals are steady. Come on. Let's go. Dr. Creo, where are you going? TOMMY: Izzi? Izzi. (SPEAKING IN MAYAN) (GRUNTING) TOMAS: No! IZZI: Finish it. Behold. (BIRDS SCREECHING) (GASPS) Oh, God! (GASPING) My queen. Now and forever. We shall be togeth...
